articles.author: QISHIN TARIQ
articles.title: Report: South-East Asia's eSports industry prefers 'mobile-first' experience - The Star Online
articles.description: Experts say South-East Asia’s eSports industry will grow in a different direction from its US and European counterparts, thanks to its preference for mobile gaming.
articles.content:
As eSports rises to the mainstream in South-East Asia (SEA), both athletes and viewers are likely to experience the sport on their phones, according to a new report.
A white paper titled Games &… [+4400 chars]

articles.author: ANI
articles.title: Taliban tighten grip on Afghanistan's Panjshir with killings, food control: Report - Times of India
articles.description: South Asia News: KABUL: Taliban have imposed a blockade in Afghanistan's Panjshir province, denying residents food and carrying out some extrajudicial killings, The Wa.
articles.content: Taliban tighten grip on Afghanistan's Panjshir with killings, food control: Report

articles.title: All jokes aside, scientists find talking duck saying 'You bloody fool!' - AsiaOne
articles.description: AMSTERDAM, Sept 10 - A Dutch scientist has uncovered old recordings of a musk duck mimicking the phrase, "You bloody fool!" — learnt when it was raised by humans in an Australian bird park. Leiden University scientist Carel Ten Cate said that what was interes…
articles.content:

articles.author: The Star Online
articles.title: Total lockdown an option as Covid cases spike in Singapore this week; cases still high in South-East Asia - The Star Online
articles.description: South-East Asia reported 75,832 new Covid-19 cases on Friday, lower than Thursday’s 80,238. There were 1,390 fatalities, almost on par with the previous day’s 1,388.
articles.content: SINGAPORE/BANGKOK, Sept 11 (The Nation Thailand/ANN): South-East Asia reported 75,832 new Covid-19 cases on Friday, lower than Thursdays 80,238. There were 1,390 fatalities, almost on par with the pr… [+1163 chars]
